page.title: 07BEEF FARMING IN CLOPHILL
page.content: At{Kiln Farm}there is a{beef raising {unit.}Some calves are born here & some are bought in. They are fed on{barley {meal, potatoes}&{sugar beet pulp.}They are sent to market at 2 yrs old. There are many cross breeds, the bull is a{Devon.}He is quite tame. We fed him by hand but stayed the other side of the fence. Mr.Gobey also keeps freerange{hens for the sale of{eggs.}He has{Marrans which are a very{Old English}breed. They lay very dark brown eggs. He also keeps{Light Sussex Bantams}whose eggs are paler. Until recently he kept many different breeds and would hatch 1000 eggs at a time in electric incubators. { Barley}is grown both for home use and to sell to the{whisky distillers}and the{brewers.}The{straw}is used for bedding for the cattle.
